title._content: ["The Elms," Edward Julius Berwind, 367 Bellevue Avenue, Newport, Rhode Island. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. ["The Elms," Edward Julius Berwind, 367 Bellevue Avenue, Newport, Rhode Island. View to entrance gates] [1914 summer] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture: Horace Trumbaurer, 1899-1901, 1911. Landscape: Horace Trumbauer, 1907-1914. Gardener: Bruce Butterton. Today: Open to the public as a house and garden museum by the Preservation Society of Newport County. On lantern slide mount: handwritten note "B" and "Berwind, E.J., Newport." Also, Johnston no. "2770." And, gold star sticker and red stroke mark. Photographed when Frances Benjamin Johnston and Mattie Edwards Hewitt worked together. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16743 Call Number: LC-J717-X108- 16
